Posts.Content: Sep 29, 2012 01:07AM cpjennings wrote: I was in your shoes a few months ago.  After dealing with the pain, rapidly appearing systoms, my husband finally took me to emergency.  I live in Stone Mountain, Georgia.  Upon arrival, my husband told the intake person, "my wife is in pain and she has no health insurance."  Her response....."we don't care, what's wrong with her?"  From that point on I was treated as if I did have insurance!!!!!  It was diagnosed that I did have Inflammatory Breast Cancer.  When the Dr. came in, the first thing she said to my husband after talking with me is, "Sir, go down to the Hospital Social Services Dept. in the morning.  I've already told them to expect you.  Fill out all the necessary paperwork because when we start treating your wife, we WILL NOT stop because of a lack of insurance.  This really blessed us.  Well, before he could get there, a rep. came by my private room with all the paperwork, explained everything, etc.  Here in Georgia and many, many other states (check yours), if a woman is diagnosed with breast cancer or ovarian cancer she is IMMEDIATELY approved for Women's Health - Breast Cancer/Ovarian Cancer Medicaid...full coverage!!!!  This program was put into effect a few years ago but unfortunately not too many frightened, uninsured women are aware of it....much like me!  I could not be covered under my husband's insurance either because it was WAY to expensive and would have not alloted enough for us to get by. In no way am I saying you have breast cancer, but what I am saying is please don't let not being insured and fear halt you from going to get checked out.  Go to emergency....that's their job...they have to see you! I'm currently in treatment.  I have a great Oncologist.  All of my prescriptions are fully covered as well as all of my treatments!  I'm provided transportation to and from my Dr. whenever I need it.  This has taken a load off of my husband and I because I can get the optimum care I need while he continues to work to keep our bills paid. As for your daughter, she's probably afraid and feeling very emotional right now with the new babies and everything.  Try not to stress over that......get yourself checked out!  It may be nothing, but if it's something, there's help available for you....please, please go to emergency........when I went, they did a breast scan and the attending ER Physician saw something and immediately called over to the main hospital and consulted with the Dr. who is not my Oncologist!  GET CHECKED OUT AND PLEASE LET ME KNOW.
